sun.jvm.hotspot.debugger

Class PageCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • sun.jvm.hotspot.debugger.PageCache

  • public class PageCache
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PageCache(long pageSize, long maxNumPages, PageFetcher fetcher)
      The pageSize must be a power of two and implicitly specifies the alignment of pages.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      A mechanism for clearing out the cache is necessary to handle detaching and reattaching
      void clear(long startAddress, long numBytes)
      A mechanism for clearing cached data covering the given region
      void disable()
      Disables the page cache; no further pages will be added to the cache and all existing pages will be flushed.
      void enable()
      Enables the page cache; fetched pages will be added to the cache.
      boolean getBoolean(long address) 
      byte getByte(long address) 
      char getChar(long address, boolean bigEndian) 
      byte[] getData(long startAddress, long numBytes)
      This handles fetches which span multiple pages by virtue of the presence of the PageFetcher.
      double getDouble(long address, boolean bigEndian) 
      float getFloat(long address, boolean bigEndian)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PageCache

        public PageCache(long pageSize,
                 long maxNumPages,
                 PageFetcher fetcher)
        The pageSize must be a power of two and implicitly specifies the alignment of pages. numPages specifies how many pages should be cached.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public byte[] getData(long startAddress,
                      long numBytes)
               throws UnmappedAddressException
        This handles fetches which span multiple pages by virtue of the presence of the PageFetcher. Throws UnmappedAddressException if a page on which data was requested was unmapped. This can not really handle numBytes > 32 bits.
        Throws:
        UnmappedAddressException

      • getBoolean

        public boolean getBoolean(long address)

      • getByte

        public byte getByte(long address)

      • getShort

        public short getShort(long address,
                      boolean bigEndian)

        public char getChar(long address,
                    boolean bigEndian)

      • getInt

        public int getInt(long address,
                  boolean bigEndian)

      • getLong

        public long getLong(long address,
                    boolean bigEndian)

      • getFloat

        public float getFloat(long address,
                      boolean bigEndian)

      • getDouble

        public double getDouble(long address,
                        boolean bigEndian)

      • clear

        public void clear(long startAddress,
                  long numBytes)
        A mechanism for clearing cached data covering the given region

      • clear

        public void clear()
        A mechanism for clearing out the cache is necessary to handle detaching and reattaching

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables the page cache; no further pages will be added to the cache and all existing pages will be flushed. Call this when the target process has been resumed.

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Enables the page cache; fetched pages will be added to the cache. Call this when the target process has been suspended.
